post_text: ASD Families - be counted!
shared_text:
Allentown Census 2020
September 2 at 3:59 PM ¬∑

We have less than 30 days to obtain a complete an accurate count of our community.

What's at stake? The City of Allentown missing out on over $89 million dollars for the next 10 years. This federal funding goes towards rental assistance, homeownership assistance, public education, public infrastructure, public health, food assistance, parks & recreation, after-school activities, and many more programs needed by residents)

It takes less than 10 minutes to complete your Census at my2020census.gov
#Census2020
#countmeinallentown
#allentowncensus2020

post_text: Superintendent Parker has been with ASD since the summer of 2017 - if you haven't gotten to know his story, how he came to Allentown, and his vision for ASD, check out this podcast on transformational leadership from earlier this week: https://bit.ly/3ivDFHl
shared_text:
Transforming Lives was live.
August 12 at 12:59 AM ¬∑

Tonight! Superintendent Parker goes on Facebook LIVE at 9 PM EST / 8 PM CST for a conversation on transformational leadership and ASD's focus on preparing students to be college and career ready, emphasizing Middle School Transformation, a critical component to student success. Under Mr. Parker‚Äôs leadership, ASD received the First Place Magna Award for Equity Programs for the work at Newcomer Academy, a PASmart grant for technology, and introduced a dual degree program in partnership with LCCC.

post_text:
Although we will begin the year with virtual learning, our goal remains to transition to an in-person instructional model later this fall. ASD will create safe entry points that correlate with the academic calendar to allow groups of students to return to our buildings based on local and state data. When the time comes to transition to in-person learning, we will implement CDC guidelines pertaining to health and safety, social distancing and other preventive measures.

Until then, all ASD students will engage in required learning through our Virtual Campus - use this link to confirm that every child in your home has the necessary technology. Once you fill out this survey, we thank you for your patience as our schools work to contact individual families to set up pick up appointments: https://bit.ly/2DTb8MK

post_text: Video from yesterday‚Äôs chamber award ceremony!
shared_text:
Allentown Chamber of Commerce
August 12 at 5:14 PM ¬∑

On August 11, 2020, the Allentown Chamber recognized the 2020 award recipients at the Virtual Allentown Chamber‚Äôs Annual Awards Reception in the following categories:

‚Ä¢ RB Collection - New Commitment Award
‚Ä¢ ADP, Inc. - Downtown Commitment Award
‚Ä¢ Keenan-Nagle Advertising, Inc. - Dedication Award
‚Ä¢ St. Luke‚Äôs Sacred Heart Campus - Good Neighbor Award

The Allentown Chamber also presented the Linda M. Anthony Scholarship Awards and presented scholarships to four outstanding and intelligent high school senior:

‚Ä¢ Sabrina Benvin from Allentown Central Catholic High School
‚Ä¢ Noreymi Rivera from Louis E. Dieruff High School
‚Ä¢ Jerolin Mendez Building 21 Allentown
‚Ä¢ Carrie Spangler from William Allen High School

Thanks to all who were able to tune in last evening to the live event. A huge thank you to our premier sponsor, Capital BlueCross, and all of our sponsors for their continued support and contribution. We would not be able to do our work without you.

‚Ä¢ Keenan-Nagle Advertising, Inc. - Dedication Award

Under our return to school plan, ASD‚Äôs Virtual Campus will serve all students to begin the school year.

The Virtual Campus focuses on developing engaged, passionate learners who are confident in their abilities and able to retain and apply the skills they build. Students will have access to high-quality digital learning platforms combined with individualized attention from our ASD teachers.

Learn more about our Virtual Campus: https://bit.ly/2XNdwM0

post_text: Online learning will look very different than what was available to students during our emergency closures this spring. Students will learn via the ASD Virtual Campus, which offers an innovative educational path that allows for the creative blend of opportunities to build the strengths of each student and meet a variety of learning needs. The online coursework aligns with required Pennsylvania Standards and provides personalized learning opportunities.
text: Online learning will look very different than what was available to students during our emergency closures this spring. Students will learn via the ASD Virtual Campus, which offers an innovative educational path that allows for the creative blend of opportunities to build the strengths of each student and meet a variety of learning needs. The online coursework aligns with required Pennsylvania Standards and provides personalized learning opportunities.

This fall, the Allentown School District will welcome all students to its Virtual Campus for the first quarter. Families - please use this form to confirm that each child in your household has the necessary technology & internet access needed to complete online learning. This will also allow families to indicate if they wish to continue with online learning through the Virtual Campus beyond the first quarter.

If you previously completed the opt-in form in July, you do NOT need to do so again.

https://bit.ly/2BAT9tR

The decision to start the school year through our Virtual Campus took into consideration a number of factors while listening to our health experts and keeping health and safety at the forefront of all decision making. A full presentation was given to the board on Thursday, explaining how we came to this recommendation. The academic team also shared some of the major improvements planned for the delivery of high-quality instruction, teacher interactions and student accountability. The full presentation is available here:

post_text: Thank you Allentown Rotary!
shared_text:
The Rotary Club of Allentown, Pennsylvania
July 20 at 12:22 PM ¬∑

Union Terrace Elementary School, requested Rotary grant funds to purchase and install Buddy Benches. This would be important, so that at recess, students would have a place to go when they feel left out, and where others can befriend them. A Buddy Bench is a simple idea to eliminate loneliness and foster friendship on the playground. It spreads the message of inclusion and kindness.https://portal.clubrunner.ca/6551/Stories/buddy-benches-installed-at-union-terrace #PeopleOfAction #allentownrotary #allentownpa #allentownschooldistrict

post_text:
A message from the Allentown School District Board of Directors: The Allentown School District Board of Directors support the children in our district and across the country whose lives are being torn apart by the racial divide we are seeing. We firmly stand against racism and violence. Allentown students need to feel safe on the streets they walk every day. They need to feel safe and supported when they come to school.‚†Ä
We encourage our students and families to speak out about racism as we work towards a more equitable experience for all. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
We hear you. We see you. We support you. ‚†Ä
#ASDCommittedToExcellence

A message from the Allentown School District Board of Directors: The Allentown School District Board of Directors support the children in our district and across the country whose lives are being torn apart by the racial divide we are seeing. ‚†Ä

post_text: Starting TODAY, parents and guardians will be able to register children for Kindergarten in the Allentown School District online! If you or someone you know has a child who will turn five (5) years old on or before September 1, 2020, families can begin the process using the Sapphire online registration portal. Visit the ASD website for more information and for additional assistance: https://bit.ly/3dmUthD

post_text: Families who are eligible for FREE/REDUCED meals in their school districts can now receive $5.70 per child per day for each missing school day through P-EBT. Families determined eligible in April may receive up to $300 per child. If you already receive SNAP, TANF Cash Assistance, or Medical Assistance, your benefits will be added to your EBT card within approximately 15 days. More information from the Lehigh Valley Food Policy Council is available in English and Spanish & on our resource page: https://bit.ly/39BzepB

post_text: #TeacherAppreciationWeek -Transitioning to Distance Learning in a district our size is no easy task! Teachers from William Penn AEDY Program were tasked with getting ALL of our students online in Edgenuity and Odysseyware. Thank you to Ms. Trumbaer-Wright, Mr. Luisser, Ms. Wood, Ms. Perkins, Mr. Kayal, Mr. Rothrock and Ms. Heberlein for creating usernames and accounts for all our teachers, 17,000 students, handling teacher & student course assignments, course customization and helping other staff members troubleshoot through the first few weeks! #ThankATeacher #ASDCommittedToExcellence

post_text: A special #TeacherAppreciationWeek surprise! It was announced today that Building 21 teacher Chris Tempro has been selected as one of only 50 teachers across the nation who won the Team TCS Teachers Contest. Winning teachers get free access to STEM resources and free entry into the New York City Marathon. A lifetime accomplishment for Chris! To help him celebrate teachers from Building 21 joined together for a parade with a little help from the Allentown & Centronia Fire Departments! #ThankATeacher #ASDCommittedToExcellence

ASD schools are directly contacting our highest need students individually to set up appointments for device distribution for our students in need. This is to help keep crowds and lines to a minimum. Please also remember to practice safe social distancing and wear a mask or facial covering.

AP Students: Do you need access to a device or internet to complete your AP coursework? Code.org, Amazon, and College Board are working together to ensure students who do not have access to technology can finish their Advanced Placement experiences. Complete this form if you need to access online AP courses, review material and exams. You will be contacted by College Board in 2-3 days.

**Please note: This is different than the K-12 ASD Technology Survey! This survey is through College Board and only for students enrolled in AP Courses.

Allentown School District
June 14, 2019 at 6:59 PM ¬∑

The week of graduation is special for all seniors, and we want to share a story of Louis E. Dieruff High School senior Gigi V. Gigi participated in the
Penn State Lehigh Valley Pathways to College and Career Program and shared with her class and teachers what it‚Äôs like to live as a young woman who is color-blind.

To celebrate the end of the year, PSU gave Gigi the gift of color in the form of adaptive glasses. She will graduate from DHS this Saturday and on Monday receive her very own pair from PSU! Check out her reaction to seeing color for the very first time when she was able to test out a pair! #Classof2019

...we‚Äôre not crying, you‚Äôre crying üò≠ üåà

IMPORTANT UPDATE for Grab & Go Meal Pickup. ASD is closed for Spring Holiday Thursday April 9 ‚Äì Monday April 13.

‚û°Ô∏è TODAY, Wednesday (April 8) ‚Äì Students will be provided meals for 4 days (Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Monday)
‚û°Ô∏è There will be NO meals distributed on Monday, April 13.
‚û°Ô∏è Two meals will be distributed on Tuesday, April 14 and Thursday April 16. Students will be provided meals for two days on each of those days.
‚û°Ô∏è Monday/Wednesday distribution will resume on Monday April 20. The same process and eligibility requirements will be in place.

Please remember to practice safe social distancing when coming for meal pickup and wear a mask or facial covering. Students must be present to receive meals. post_text:
Happy Census Day!

It is time to Make Your Count Matter by completing the Census 2020 for your household so our community will have a full count. The Census is important to every person living in Allentown and the Lehigh Valley as a region. As we all experience the hardships our healthcare networks and local businesses are going through, we must Make Our Count Matter.

Our census count determines the money provided to our community for essential services such as healthcare, schools, meal programs, infrastructure and more. What we are learning as we overcome COVID-19, is that we must be prepared. Your participation in Census 2020 will be the first step in how we prepare for the next 10 years.

Complete the Census today online at: my2020census.gov or by phone at: 844-330-2020 (English) / 844-468-2020 (Spanish). #Imcounted #census2020
text:

As we all experience the hardships our healthcare networks and local businesses are going through, we must Make Our Count Matter.

Our census count determines the money provided to our community for essential services such as healthcare, schools, meal programs, infrastructure and more. What we are learning as we overcome COVID-19, is that we must be prepared. Your participation in Census 2020 will be the first step in how we prepare for the next 10 years.

Complete the Census today online at: my2020census.gov or by phone at: 844-330-2020 (English) / 844-468-2020 (Spanish). #Imcounted #census2020

Today, Governor Tom Wolf ordered an extension to the school closures in our state until at least April 6, 2020. The extend closure will continue to affect all Allentown School District programming, including before- and after-school activities, all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, and all weekend events. No date for the return of students has been identified yet. We will communicate a student return date once that is available. Please continue to check our website and social media channels for the most up to date information regarding meal pickup and academic enrichment.
https://bit.ly/2YhFUYi

shared_text:
YMCA of Allentown PA
March 15 at 12:00 PM ¬∑

In the wake of recent government announcements and mandated closures, the Y has decided to temporarily close our facilities until further notice, effective as of tomorrow 3/16. However, all Y Branches and the Forks Education Center will continue to operate Early Childhood Education, Preschool Programming and temporary School Age Child Care as long as we may do so safely, responsibly and in line with prevailing public health advisement. Other essential services including our Allentown Warming Station and our free Youth Meals Programming will continue to operate for as long as possible. We thank you for your support of the Y during this unprecedented time.

Allentown School District
March 14 at 10:15 PM ¬∑

URGENT ALERT FOR FAMILIES AND COMMUNITY - during this long term closure period will provide extended monitoring of Let‚ÄôsTalk communication system. Our Family and Community Engagement staff will provide extending monitoring of incoming questions from families and the community between the hours of 8:00 AM and 8:00 PM.

If you have a question, please use the link below or access the Let's Talk icon on the District website or through the app. Your questions will be acknowledged immediately through the system. All questions will be responded to within a two-hour window of time. Please know as this global pandemic evolves there may be questions we cannot answer as a District, however, all questions will be acknowledged in a timely fashion.

Our ASD community will continue to receive continuous updates via the designated COVID-19 page on the District website, District mobile app, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

If you have any questions about your child, we are here to help:

http://bit.ly/2IMDCXN

shared_text:
Allentown PA Parks and Recreation
March 13 at 7:11 PM ¬∑

PARK RESTROOM CLOSURES

Effective Friday, March 13 the City of Allentown Parks & Recreation Department is closing three, year-round restroom facilities that do not have running water available.

These three bathrooms require a hand sanitizer station to be open. Because of the COVID-19 Pandemic, the city is not able to secure additional supplies for those bathrooms at this time.

The restroom facilities that are closing are in Lehigh Parkway at Robin Hood Bridge, Fly Shop and Lil Le Hi Trout Nursery.

Bathrooms facilities at Cedar Beach Playground, Trexler Park, Lehigh Parkway along Park Drive, and the Malcolm Gross Rose Garden have running water available and remain open.

post_text:
ASD CLOSED MARCH 12 & 13: Early this evening, we were informed that an ASD employee presented with symptoms and was tested for COVID-19. Over the past few days, we have been in communication with the local and state Health Department officials. Out of an abundance of caution and to ensure the safety and wellness of our students and staff, the district will be closed for cleaning starting tomorrow, Thursday, March 12th and Friday, March 13th. Our plan is to reopen on Monday, March 16th. Our maintenance staff will use this time to perform a thorough cleaning of all district facilities. It is important to reiterate that there are no known or reported cases of COVID-19 in the Allentown School District. In this case, caution is critical and our students, staff, and families are the priority.

Read the full update here: http://bit.ly/3aNDByz

post_text:
The ‚ÄúRising to Excellence and I Shall Rise Award‚Äù ceremony will recognize at least 25 High School students in the Allentown School District; as achieving, improving and/or overcoming obstacles at school and at home. Students who have been chosen will be required to read their essay, poem or explain their art-painting.

Participants will be announced at the ceremony will be held at the Barrister‚Äôs Club on Sunday, March 15, 2020 from 2:00pm-4:30pm. They will receive a Certificate of Appreciation and other gifts at the ceremony.

Teachers/staff/community members can also nominate students who have risen to academic excellence so far this school year. Deadline: Tuesday, February 25 / email events@allentownpa.gov. See your guidance counselor or school parent liaison for more information. #ASDCommittedToExcellence

post_text: Prior to today's budget address, board president Sara Brace and Superintendent Thomas Parker met with Governor Wolf. The Governor's 2020-21 proposed budget addressed charter school funding. Specifics include addressing the charter school funding formula, closing special education loopholes and stronger accountability measures for charter schools while still empowering choice in Pennsylvania.
text: Prior to today's budget address, board president Sara Brace and Superintendent Thomas Parker met with Governor Wolf. The Governor's 2020-21 proposed budget addressed charter school funding. Specifics include addressing the charter school funding formula, closing special education loopholes and stronger accountability measures for charter schools while still empowering choice in Pennsylvania.

post_text: As January winds down, we continue to spotlight members of the ASD board during school director recognition month! Today, meet Ms. Lisa Conover! Lisa Conover was first elected to the board in 2017 and serves as a co-chair for the education committee, safety task force, legislative and policy committees. She also represents ASD with the Carbon Lehigh Intermediate Unit and LCTI Joint Operating Committee. Ms. Conover's professional experience includes working as a realtor and serving as the former chamber of commerce president. She has also worked as an LCTI substitute instructor. Ms. Conover is the proud parent of a Dieruff graduate. She is full of #HuskyPride, but works as an advocate for all students in ASD. #ASDCommittedToExcellence #PBSA

She also represents ASD with the Carbon Lehigh Intermediate Unit and LCTI Joint Operating Committee. post_text: Linda Vega is one of our newest board members, elected in 2019. Outside of ASD she works as a human resources manager in the healthcare field. She will bring that expertise to the negotiations and personnel committee. She serves on boards of several other community organizations that empower and support women in the Lehigh Valley, the Allentown Citywide Initiative for Youth and the city Human Relations Commission. Ms. Vega is also the founder of Rylic Community & Arts. As a new board member, she looks forward helping those who feel unheard and giving them a voice. Her goal is to make everyone feel like they belong here as a part of the ASD community. #ASDCommittedToExcellence #PBSA

post_text:
The Pennsylvania Department of Education, Bureau of Special Education (BSE), monitors all school districts and charter schools in the state at least once every six years to ensure that they are complying with federal and state regulations for special education. This year, the Allentown School District will be reviewed.

As part of this monitoring, the BSE is seeking parent opinions about the special education services being provided. In addition to surveying parents, PDE is also interested in hearing directly from students about their educational experience. Click here for parent and student surveys:
http://bit.ly/2sKadci

What a great way to highlight our students! Make sure to follow your child‚Äôs school for the latest news, photos and updates!

Posted @withrepost ‚Ä¢ @asdroosevelt ‚≠êÔ∏èSTUDENT SPOTLIGHT‚≠êÔ∏è
Welcome to Roosevelt‚Äôs weekly social media feature, where we give special recognition to a child who represents the values of our school.

Luis is a selfless, kindhearted, and supportive third grader. While some students spend their lunch period goofing off, he chooses to spend his lunch time helping friends practice their sight words because he wants them to become better readers!

Thank you, Luis, for caring so much about the success of your classmates! ‚≠êÔ∏èStay tuned for another STUDENT SPOTLIGHT next week!‚≠êÔ∏è Photo Credit: @sylviayoungkinphoto

post_text:
Did you know? January is School Director Recognition Month!
Join us in celebrating the ASD school board directors who volunteer their time to serve students, schools, families and greater Allentown community. Our board works to ensure that every ASD student graduates college, career and community ready. Throughout the month we will highlight each board member on our social media channels, so stay tuned!

#SchoolDirectorRecognitionMonth #ASDCommittedtoExcellence

post_text: This morning ASD launches the largest single strategic initiative from our district framework. During this LIVE broadcast, detail will be revealed on the middle school transformation model ASD plans to implement, which includes expansion of the Community School model, increased partnership from the United Way and additional partnerships with major businesses that will assist in the dramatic and comprehensive transformation of each middle school within the Allentown School District.
text: This morning ASD launches the largest single strategic initiative from our district framework. During this LIVE broadcast, detail will be revealed on the middle school transformation model ASD plans to implement, which includes expansion of the Community School model, increased partnership from the United Way and additional partnerships with major businesses that will assist in the dramatic and comprehensive transformation of each middle school within the Allentown School District.

post_text: The middle school years are critical to our students academic journey. Our community has rallied around the district in support of improving academic rigor, increasing college & career exposure, and improving school-level climate within in ASD middle schools. Tomorrow morning tune in to our social channels for detail on how ASD plans to approach this dynamic transformation.
text: The middle school years are critical to our students academic journey. Our community has rallied around the district in support of improving academic rigor, increasing college & career exposure, and improving school-level climate within in ASD middle schools. Tomorrow morning tune in to our social channels for detail on how ASD plans to approach this dynamic transformation.
